). The GLM analysis indicated a positive relationship
between temperature niche similarity and the four emission scenarios (2.6, 4.5, 6.0, and
8.5), and a positive effect between niche breadth in temperature and the two emission
scenarios (6.0 and 8.5). Moreover, we detected positive relationships between niche
similarity in temperature for all models and expansion areas (
Niche breadth is positively correlated with the geographic distribution of species (
change, we found that climatic niche breadth and similarity are positively correlated
with refugia size and temperature, a result consistent with previous evidence (
). In our arid lineages, species with wide climatic niches and more
dissimilar niches (non-grouping niche position) would be less affected by global warming
compared to species with more narrow climatic niches. In addition, species with
narrow distributions or habitat specialist species may be more prone to extinction after
), since there is a positive relationship between the size of
